comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The Coney Island "Mardi Gras" (so-called) was an annual celebration, a week-long debauch, held at the end of the summer season, during which the saloons were licenced to stay open around the clock. This photo is from the 1913, event, which commenced on September 8. Here is another Bain/LOC photo from the 1913 celebration:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4257088442/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: CONEY MARDI GRAS DRAWS HUGE CROWD: Story in The New York Times, September 9, 1913: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9B0CE1D8113BE6...
